meanings.definition: To bring under a single control or authority.
meanings.sent1: The teacher centralizes the classroom by assigning tasks to each student.
meanings.sent2: The company centralizes its operations by having all decisions made by the CEO.
meanings.sent3: The cat centralizes its toys in one corner of the room, claiming it as its territory.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style centralizes power like a magnet pulling all decisions towards her.
meanings.sent5: The sun centralizes its rays on the flower, making it bloom beautifully.

meanings.definition: To concentrate power or control in a central organization or group.
meanings.sent1: The government centralizes its authority to ensure efficient decision-making.
meanings.sent2: The new policy centralizes decision-making power in the hands of a few executives.
meanings.sent3: The joke centralizes all the laughter in the room on one unsuspecting individual.
meanings.sent4: Her charisma centralizes attention on her during meetings, making her a natural leader.
meanings.sent5: The storm centralizes its force on the coast, causing massive destruction.
